September 18 protests: Protestors caught between anger and disillusionment
subhead: Eight days after the 'Block Everything' protest movement on September 10, the union coalition called for mobilization against 'austerity' on Thursday, September 18. More than 250 gatherings took place across France, demanding a change in political direction and greater tax justice.
byline: By Camille Bordenet (Besançon (eastern France), special correspondent), Benjamin Keltz (Morlaix (northwestern France), special correspondant), Géraldine Houot, Aline Leclerc, Thibaud Métais, Violaine Morin, Eléa Pommiers, Gilles Rof (Marseille (France) correspondent) and Florence Traullé (Dunkirk (northern France), special correspondante)

Italy's 'Meloni model' of fiscal discipline masks an illiberal shift
subhead: Since becoming Italian prime minister in 2022, Giorgia Meloni has become a model that the French right aspires to emulate, even though her supposed success is more narrative than reality, with Italy continuing to struggle with low productivity and rising poverty.

title: The Argentine Church ramps up criticism of President Javier Milei's austerity measures
subhead: From priests working in shantytowns to bishops, representatives of the institution have condemned the government's budget cuts.

title: Previously unknown Picasso portrait revealed in Paris
subhead: The colorful oil painting, entitled 'Bust of a woman with a flowery hat,' depicts Dora Maar, an artist and Pablo Picasso's muse. It is being put up for auction in Paris, with a reserve price of €8 million.

title: Eleven places in France to visit during 2025 European Heritage Days
subhead: Each fall, the event opens doors to historic sites that are usually closed to the public. Le Monde picks 11 of the most compelling hidden gems in France.

title: An abbey in southern France rescued by contemporary art
subhead: 'Strange places for an exhibition' (6/6). Le Monde explores six art centers set up in unusual locations. Today: a magnificent Cistercian abbey rescued from ruin by Geneviève Bonnefoi and Pierre Brache.

title: A cappuccino war breaks out in Berlin
subhead: In the German capital, a coffee chain is booming on the promise of affordable prices. The success is generating as much enthusiasm as hostility, with some seeing it as the work of destructive 'turbo-capitalism.'
